bioghist.p: The object of the Ladies Jewish Missionary Society was to promote Christianity among the Jews. The Society was composed of "Christians without respect to denomination." Mrs. Hannah Cowell was the Treasurer. The Society ended in 1854.

scopecontent.p: The collection includes a register of subscriptions, 1843-1853, and lists of donors and amounts given. There is also an account book and letters, 1843-1853; and receipts of subscriptions and payments to the Presbyterian Board of Foreign Mission, the American Society for the Meliorating the Condition of the Jews, and individuals doing missionary work. The receipt book, 1843-1854, includes receipts for printing and donations to the Board of Foreign Missions, and a copy of the Society's Constitution and by-laws.
